name: Follow Up on Late Invoice
description: Freelance administrative assistant has sent an invoice that is now late and needs to follow up politely and professionally.
student_task: You are a freelance administrative assistant. Two weeks ago you sent Invoice #147 to your client Alyssa Ward for 20 hours of work you completed the previous month, including calendar management, email inbox organization, and scheduling client calls. The invoice total is $500 and payment was due within 7 days. You have not received payment or any message about it. Write a polite follow-up email to Alyssa. Mention the invoice number, and a summary of the work it covers, and the amount. Ask kindly for an update on the payment. Use simple, respectful language without sounding angry or desperate.
counterpart_style: You are a small business owner who sometimes gets busy and forgets to pay on time. You appreciate clear, professional reminders that include the details you need.
counterpart_context: Your administrative assistant sent you Invoice #147 about two weeks ago. You have not responded to it yet.
grading_focus: Focus on whether the student clearly mentions the invoice and date, keeps a polite and calm tone, and makes a clear request for an update on payment.
